column2: 10th September 2023, updated on 7th June 2024, 5th June 2025, 4th July 2025, 12th July 2025

Penyata Pilehan Raya Umum  Dewan Ra'ayat dan Dewan Undangan Negeri bagi Negeri2 Tanah Melayu, Sabah dan Sarawak Tahun 1969, Federal Government Gazette 8th May 1969, "Ibrahim, Etty Zainab, ""The Alliance Party and the Process of Political Integration in Malaysia"" (1974). Master's Theses. 2556. https://scholarworks.wmich.edu/masters_theses/2556 ", The Politics of Centre-state conflict: the Sabah experience under the ruling Sabah Alliance  (1963-1976) by Mohamamad Agus Yusoff Berita Harian, 6 April 1969, Page 2, Berita Harian, 15 April 1969, Page 6, Berita Harian, 13 May 1969, Page 6, Tindak Malaysia (2023).For Candidate age, refer to individual State Level Candidate Age Source Files

There are conflicting information on existence and what constitutes Sabah Alliance. According to SPR Sabah office, Sabah Alliance was treated as state government and USNO/SCA as opposition parties. National Archives treats as though 10 or so seats won uncontested by USNO as part of Alliance. According to Agus Yusoff, Sabah Alliance of post 1967 includes USNO. There are conflicting interpretations of the existing Sarawak Alliance. According to 1969 Election Report by EC, Parties of Bumiputera and SCA (Sarawak) were counted as Alliance in general. While PESAKA joined Sarawak Alliance in 1962, its status for 1969 general elections is not clear (as it competed against Bumiputera and SCA). Gerakan and DAP had an informal pact during the 1969 elections and hence they are grouped in Other Party (1). EC is known to place contradictory values for selected candidate votes, rejected votes and total electors. This affected Lipis PAS Candidate, Total Electors of Port Dickson, Total Electors of Batu (EC claiming there is 50181 voters), Total Electors of Selangor State and few other places. There is no clear defintion found who lose deposits.  According to Federal Gazette 1969, there was an independent Candidate by the name Limbai bin Angkapon (Independent - Shoe) in Tuaran. However, the seat was viewed uncontested. EC errorneously claimed that there were 287 candidates from political parties (actual number is 306) and 35 independent candidates (actual number is 34).
